Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Crash”
Reviews.Author: Tenoch
Reviews.Content: Drove to Dallas on a spur of the moment getaway and stayed here. This hotel was clean and comfortable. Close to everything! and a nice place to come back to after being out all day! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Lindsmac
Reviews.Content: Stayed a weekend at this hotel during a girls' weekend shopping trip. We checked in after 5:00 following a day at the outlets and the service was wonderful. The room was very nice and clean. I slept so well! The front desk employees suggested a nearby restaurant for us and offered use of the shuttle so we didn't have to drive. He gave us a card and we called when we were ready to head back to the hotel. Very friendly employees. The location is great for shopping near Highland Park Village and other shops. I would definitely recommend to others. We didn't eat in the restaurant but grabbed a drink at the bar. Again good service.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: nightingale1972
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in other Courtyard by Marriott hotels, my husband and I chose this hotel on a recent trip to Dallas. We attended a workshop nearby and the hotel was very close. It was also conveniently located to downtown and other points of interest. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, but it was not exceptional. There was space in the bureau for a small refrigerator; however, there was none. Breakfast was not complimentary; however, the Bistro was quite good. The staff were very courteous, especially those at the Bistro. Although wi-fi was available, it was not very fast. I would probably stay again, but might check out other places as well.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ResearcherMD
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent wedding party rate, which is why we stayed at this property. It was fine. Nothing jumped out as exceptional, but it was very nice to have a bistro in the lobby for a good coffee in the morning. The room was good, with free wifi and decent toiletries. Parking is free. Getting to downtown Dallas was a breeze from here, as was access to both interstates 30 and 35, as well as state 75. There is a small bistro in the lobby for snacks and meals, but the only restaurant you can walk to is Denny's...I recommend driving to Eatzi's on Oak Lawn for sandwiches, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Superb Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: AdityaGarg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for almost a month and can safely say that this is one of the excellent hotels near Dallas downtown and to top it up it has got very courteous staff. One can be easily spoilt by the choices available for breakfast. The amenities are good. Property is clean and easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great little escape near downtown”
Reviews.Author: ladybug2056
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in town for a Cowboys game. The Market Center area is not that desireable but this hotel was a diamond in the rough! We got a great deal on the room and enjoyed a balcony view of the Dallas skyline! We were able to walk to Denny's for breakfast and enjoyed cocktails both nights out on our patio. The pool and patio area looked nice although we did not use it. There is also an outdoor fire pit. The only complaint I have is that our housekeeper did not come to clean our room until about 5pm. Luckily this did not affect our plans at all but I was suprised that it took so long for them to come. I'd definitely come back again! I do not recommend staying at the Fairfield Inn next door. It needs some work!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: djgato
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at this little paradise, however I felt it like my home away from home. I would like to mention Cyndy, who gave me a big smile and checked me in, she gave me all kind of information I needed and I could see she enjoyed her work!,Carmen, who made my morning being patient with me with the check out and showed me many ways to get into the swimming pool and fitness area; when going to the elevator, there was an employee who stopped doing his work and with a great smile greeted me and finally I couldnt enter into the fitness area and Otilia gently opened the door for me! What a great family at the Courtyard, of course my room was lovely and tidy with a fresh scent. I would have loved to stay more days!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: SCOTTINMASS
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 3-night stay at the CM during a business trip. This CM is very convenient to both DFW and DAL (it took me 20 mins to get to DFW). The conference I was attending was at the Hilton Anatole which is across the street so I didn't have to drive to the Hilton and pay $16 per day to park! I also didn't have to pay for wireless at the CM (although it was very slow). The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The drapes were amazing because they really blocked out the light in the morning so I could sleep. This hotel has a little "bistro" in the lobby that has very limited but freshly made options for breakfast and dinner including wine and a few cocktails. It was a really nice touch to get something to eat quickly and at a reasonable price. My biggest complaint was that my key card didn't work on three different occasions and the towels are a little thin but that's to be expected. I generally stay at 4-star hotels but after this experience I will give the CM another look in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay in for Seminar”
Reviews.Author: sahmiamftworth
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff was so helpful. I was really impressed with their "above and beyond" attitude. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Beds and linens were also. While the complimentary breakfast offered was small it was tasty and had variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: straw71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Marriott, on a family road trip to Dallas. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a really chic Bistro in the lobby with modern furniture. The room was nice with the great "Marriott beds". Had a nice view of the pool from my window. The only complaint I have is there was no a/c in the hallways, and on the elevator, and July in Dallas, it was 102 outside !

Reviews.Title: “I will be returning!”
Reviews.Author: JAYLUV1
Reviews.Content: Courtyard Marriott constantly provided me with a warm welcome with a modern look (interior of property). The rooms where clean with updated technology (TV). The staff was well informed of his and her surroundings. There was one downfall and that was the elevator. I believe there was only one elevator and you can tell that it has been used a great deal. Not for sure if there was a cooling issues or not but that is my only issue with the Courtyard by Marriott Dallas Market Center. I do not want to start on location, all I have to say is loved it (with a high pitch voice)! For the visitors new to the Dallas area, you will not feel intimated about getting around because the main roads as well as freewayâ€™s are near. Also, with the economy in an uproar having free parking helped my budget. I am glad that Marriott is spending money to renovate but I which they will do some renovations to the sister property right next door (Fairfield). I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Safe bet.”
Reviews.Author: annchgo
Reviews.Content: Very clean, updated and trendy hotel. All in all very nice. Nice fitness room. Only complaint was that it was impossible to find luggage carts. We waited forever for staff to find them both when we arrived and when we departed. We had a lot of stuff with us due to a move.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel wish we had more time there...”
Reviews.Author: rmcdonald41
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice location right alongside the highway, a few blocks from downtown Dallas. Great bistro located in the lobby area. Gym, pool and sauna all looked nice even though we didn't time to enjoy them. Surprisingly quiet given the location and full house. Cons: No room service, but I guess you can't always be lazy so this really shouldn't count. Also, there are a few transients in the area so be safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not near a lot of stuff.”
Reviews.Author: bharrisuga
Reviews.Content: Hotel was your basic Courtyard. Nothing to write home about. There were lobby renovations during our stay, but we knew that going in. Staff was nice. As long as you plan on driving to dinner and other things, not a bad place, but not very convenient to all Dallas has to offer. Will recommend based on hotel and cost, not location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Courtyard I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: ericsf
Reviews.Content: Don't believe some of the bad reviews on here.This is my second time staying at this courtyard. This is an excellent courtyard and probably one of the best courtyards I have ever stayed in. All the rooms are newly renovated with flat screen tvs. My room was spotless. The pool has brand new outdoor furniture and sofas and a nice fire pit. The lobby is the new courtyard design which I absolutely love. It has the to go counter which has delicious food. Of all the hotels in the neighborhood this is the best one in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are wrong, this place is great!”
Reviews.Author: kjwzoom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Nov. 7-10th and found it very clean, super efficient, centrally located, and a good value. Check-in was a breeze, the staff was warm and cheerful, giving me full choice of where my room was. Room was very clean, spacious and newer. The hotel just underwent a huge renovation, rooms and lobby. I had a king-bed room, great bed, super comfortable, clean triple-sheeted. The A/C unit functioned well and keep my room ice-cold. Free wireless internet was a big plus. Shower pressure was excellent. The hotel offers a business center, great Bistro open for breakfast and dinner (good food with reasonable rates), outdoor/indoor pool and whirlpool. We were in Dallas for a work function, and the hotel staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. For evenings, far enough outside of downtown to be quiet but close enough for a cheap cab to the American Airlines Center (Mavs) or whatever you want to do. All in all, great hotel, fantastic staff, many amenities, and not deserving of the bad reviews. Stay here, no disappointment. Sales Manager Terry will treat you right. THANKS MARRIOTT!

Reviews.Title: “Urine stained beds”
Reviews.Author: Dancynn
Reviews.Content: The carpet is new, but the mattresses are old, filthy and smelled like urine. The "newly renovated" refers to the carpet only. Management is horrible and smokers are welcome. If you are a chain smoker, enjoy the smell of urine, then this is the place for you. Management should be ashamed of themselves. I am a gold member and I checked out after seeing these mattresses are at least 10 years old with bugs on them. Ick.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Management”
Reviews.Author: djmcatx
Reviews.Content: Worse service from the staff I have ever had. Would never return for any reason. Do not expect good service at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Staff, Rooms Needed Upgrading, Roaches In Room”
Reviews.Author: MoovinOn
Reviews.Content: This is an older Courtyard property. The common areas are in very good condition but the rooms need upgrading. The furniture, bed and TV are all showing their age. The furniture is worn and stained, the bed sags a bit and the TV's performance was poor. When I first stepped into my room I saw three roaches in the bathroom area. I managed to kill one but the other two got away. It has been years since I have seen roaches in a hotel room. The room was clean but the presence of the roaches point to a problem somewhere. I ate dinner and breakfast at the hotel. Both meals were very good and the wait staff was great. I would not recommend this hotel primarily because of the roaches I found in my room. The room condition should be improved soon if this property wishes to compete with other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel room had no microwave or refrigerator as expected.”
Reviews.Author: stcpat
Reviews.Content: Certain rooms had a microwave and refrigerator provided; however, I was unable to secure one of these during my two-night stay. In addition, the hotel offered breakfast on the website as being included in the price; however, when I arrived at the hotel - the desk clerk told me it was at an additional fee.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Meehdi
Reviews.Content: I would definately not recommend this hotel because they have bed bugs! I stayed there 2 weeks ago on October 4th and the morning after I had lots of bites on my fingers and in various other places. And when I returned home I continued to get more bites only to discover that the bugs had gotten into my luggage and are now in my home. I would suggest being VERY cautious before you stay there but the best thing to do would be to find a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Standard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prashpai
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business. This is directly across the road from Hilton Anatole and is sort of tucked away behind the highway. 5 min drive will get you to a lot of good restaurants. Perfect nice quiet place to stay for work travel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Really Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: AJTravelTrips
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by calling the 1-800 number for Marriott when our other hotel turned out to be less than expected. This Marriot hotel is very well located. It is right off the highway to get to downtown Dallas, and a short drive away from House of Blues (which was a great place to snag a late night dinner!). The rooms, although not big, were clean and comfortable. But, the reason I will definitely come back is the incredibly great staff at the front desk. They were all friendly and welcoming from the start, and were happy to help us with any questions we had. The hotel has detailed, printed directions for all the major attractions in Dallas, and the staff is happy to help you print off mapquest or googlemap directions to anywhere else you need to go. The business center at the hotel was very handy and helpful -- with two computers and a printer. Every room is hooked up with WiFi as well. We were very satisfied with our stay and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “It's fine”
Reviews.Author: mabelsc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Courtyard because the Renaissance was completely booked. Not particularly impressed but not disappointed, since it was business travel. The restaurant was rather nice and so was the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great little marriott”
Reviews.Author: Ms.Travels
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this property recently and I have nothing but compliments. It's a Courtyard with the standard amenitites, including a workout room, outdoor pool and a little market in the lobby so that you can buy snacks. In addition to the breakfast buffet in the mornings, the lobby restaurant also serves some dinner items. (I did not eat there.) There is a Denny's 2 buildings over. The staff were very pleasant and I enjoyed being able to use the free internet. My room was standard marriott set up, very clean and everything in working order. If you are looking for a less expensive alternative, the courtyard is almost connected to the Fairfield Marriott, which I also stayed in for a few dollars less for a few night. According to the front desk staff, the properties are co-owned, so guests are welcome to use any of the amenities in either. If you stay here, you should go across the street to view the Hilton Anatole - it is a huge (HUGE) hotel with a interesting art collection. The concierge will supply you with a brochure and map of same. The Anatole also has a lounge with an amazing view, have an expensive drink or just a cheap look at the skyline! (Also has several restaurants.)

Reviews.Title: “A good 3-star hotel - but that's it”
Reviews.Author: DenverBrian
Reviews.Content: Recent gushing reviews over this Courtyard near the Dallas city center seem to focus primarily on cleanliness ("extra clean, "immaculate") and perhaps value. While this is an average representative for Courtyards in general, I don't think it's the #4 hotel in the Dallas metro area. This Courtyard has been refurbed in the current Courtyard room scheme, although they retained the old mirrored sliding doors on the closets and the original (c. 1990) tile and surround in the bathroom. More significantly, the HVAC is quite loud; corridors and hallways have carpet that isn't being cleaned regularly; exterior entrances are worn, with painting and other maintenance needed; the elevators are slow, clunky, and have significant scratches and near-grafitti on the inside doors; and there are disconcerting "Watch Your Car" signs posted by the Dallas Police at several spots in the parking lot. All of this is easily forgiveable at a price point of oh, say, $120 a night; but at $169 a night, the value proposition is below average, especially when a comparable Courtyard (Central Expressway) is $149 and the nearby Renaissance and Marriott Suites full-service properties are $229. Unless you have reservations at Medieval Times (which is adjacent), there are better Marriott options nearby and less expensive Courtyard options about the same distance from the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel have stayed there twice!”
Reviews.Author: rebelyell
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The place is extra clean and was 2 years ago when I first stayed there. The staff is great and will do anything to help you. I travel alot and spend about 50-60 nights a year in hotels. This place is what a nice affordable hotel should be like.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jayala2k
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is not new, but the hotel is in immaculate condition. Great hotel for business or vacation travel because of their very comfortable rooms, friendly staff and great selection of dining close by.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything is absolutely wonderful! This hotel was recently remodeled including a starbucks & big screen television & bar area in the lobby. The rooms are top-notch & have wonderful views from all rooms (I've stayed here several times). I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a hotel with everything for a price that's great! Also has free high-speed internet (usually costs 9.95/24 hour usage period).

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Dallas Market Center
HotelInfo.Address: 2150 Market Center Blvd, at Stemmons Freeway/I-35, Dallas, TX 75207
